item.title: Lynette White murder: Cardiff Five are victims, chief says
item.description: Five men spent time in prison when they were wrongly accused of killing Lynette White in 1988.

item.title: Prostate cancer: Apology over failure to monitor patients
item.description: Eight patients treated in England were not appropriately monitored, a report finds.

item.title: 999 emergency call rates among highest in history, BT says
item.description: Some people call when they need a lift home or for a toothache, the longest-serving operator says.

item.title: Cymmer crash: Man arrested as family pay tribute to motorcyclist
item.description: James Huxtable, 41, was killed while riding his motorcycle in Neath Port Talbot on Tuesday.

item.title: NHS boss Andrew Goodall to become Wales' most senior civil servant
item.description: One of Wales' most visible officials Andrew Goodall will become Welsh government's permanent secretary.

item.title: Climbing: All-women Pinnacle Club celebrates its centenary
item.description: An all-women club for climbers marks its centenary where it began - in Snowdonia.

item.title: Weather: Wales sees hottest September night on record
item.description: Tropical temperatures break a 72-year record as the mercury does not dip below 20.5C for 24 hours.

item.title: Black Lives Matter: Ex-mayor reprimand for 'monkeys' comparison
item.description: Peter Kraus quit after comparing Black Lives Matter protesters to monkeys jumping on cars.

item.title: Wales 0-0 Estonia: Wales dealt severe blow in bid to qualify for 2022 World Cup
item.description: Wales' hopes of qualifying automatically for the World Cup are all but over after they are held to a goalless draw by group minnows Estonia.

item.title: Covid: Positive Anglesey care home staff cover shift amid shortage
item.description: Two care home staff worked to cover a night-shift gap as there was no emergency cover available.

item.title: M4: Two lanes closed near Chepstow by cow on road
item.description: The animal was spotted on the motorway, close to the Prince of Wales Bridge.

item.title: Rugby player's six-hour wait for ambulance on pitch
item.description: Eifion Pughe could not be moved as he had fractured his pelvis in two places during a game.

item.title: Lynette White murder: Man falsely accused relives 'nightmare'
item.description: Five men spent time in prison after being wrongly accused of killing Lynette White in 1988.

item.title: Pontypridd market street food Michelin-star chefs for food gong
item.description: Janet Wei beat some chefs who worked in Michelin-star restaurants to claim the title.

item.title: Rare angelshark filmed in Welsh waters 'for first time'
item.description: Angelsharks are an endangered species but the young spotting proves they are breeding in the UK

item.title: Dementia in dogs 'heartbreaking', says Wrexham woman
item.description: Staffie cross Poppy is one of the 10% of dogs with dementia who get a diagnosis.

item.title: Iron Age hillfort at risk from the sea in Gwynedd
item.description: Archaeologists return to a 2,000-year-old Welsh hillfort which is being reclaimed by the Irish Sea.

item.title: Recycling: How do you transform old PPE into something new?
item.description: Turning millions of disposable masks and medical waste into new items is one firm's new mission.

item.title: Hannah Cain: Leicester forward switches from England to Wales
item.description: Wales manager Gemma Grainger includes Leicester City's Hannah Cain as she names a strong 26-player squad to begin World Cup qualifying.

item.title: 2022 World Cup in Qatar: Wales' various qualification routes explained
item.description: With Wales halfway through their World Cup qualifying campaign, BBC Sport Wales examines their various routes to Qatar.

item.title: Robert Page frustrated with Wales' 0-0 World Cup qualifying draw with Estonia
item.description: Manager Robert Page rues Wales' missed chances after a "frustrating" 0-0 World Cup qualifying draw with Estonia.

item.title: World Cup of Darts: Wales' Gerwyn Price and Jonny Clayton confident they can defend title
item.description: Wales' star duo Gerwyn Price and Jonny Clayton are determined to defend their World Cup of Darts title.

item.title: Freak eye injury left Cardiff's Will Boyde struggling to see new-born daughter
item.description: Cardiff's Will Boyde describes the aftermath of a "freak" injury that led to months of lost vision.

item.title: Cwnstabl yn cydnabod 'Pump Caerdydd' fel 'dioddefwyr'
item.description: Cafodd y pump o ddynion eu carcharu ôl cael eu cyhuddo ar gam o ladd Lynette White yn 1988.

item.title: Annog pobl i 'stopio am funud a meddwl' cyn ffonio 999
item.description: Mae Mary Davies wedi bod yn ateb galwadau brys ers dros 50 mlynedd, ac mae'r gwaith yn brysurach nag erioed.

item.title: Cofnodi naw marwolaeth Covid a 2,297 achos newydd
item.description: Mae'r gyfradd achosion fesul 100,000 o bobl dros y saith diwrnod diwethaf wedi codi i dros 500.

item.title: 3 Llun: Lluniau pwysicaf bywyd Caryl Parry Jones
item.description: Y gantores sydd yn rhannu'r lluniau sydd agosaf at ei chalon.

item.title: Cyhoeddi carfan gref i ddechrau ymgyrch Cwpan y Byd 2023
item.description: Mae Hannah Cain wedi'i chynnwys am y tro cyntaf ar ôl penderfynu cynrychioli Cymru'n hytrach na Lloegr.
